poem:
Title: "The Unsung Harmonies of Repair"

Into the sidewalk-cracked heart of a tired radio,
lingers the thread of time, guided by fingers old,
a whispered intimacy shared in silence, bold,
between a human heartbeat and wife's radio.
Musings of unseen frequencies, a bittersweet woe,
Feltz's voice echoing within the analogue's fold,
The clandestine story of repairs, in my verses, told.
